checks.name: Incomplete Risk Mitigation Planning
checks.description: Supply chain risk mitigation lacks comprehensive planning and implementation tracking

unmitigatedCriticalRisks: Payment processor single point of failure

testResults.details: 48.9% mitigation plan coverage with 24 unaddressed risks
40% critical risk mitigation rate with 3 unmitigated critical risks
Limited contractual, technical, and operational controls implementation

checks.remediation: HIGH PRIORITY: 1) Develop comprehensive mitigation plans for all 47 identified risks with clear timelines and resource allocation, 2) Immediately address 3 unmitigated critical risks including payment processor dependency and identity provider lock-in, 3) Strengthen contractual controls with security requirements, audit rights, and incident notification clauses, 4) Implement comprehensive vendor access monitoring and data flow controls, 5) Develop alternative vendor options for critical services with tested contingency plans, 6) Establish automated mitigation tracking and effectiveness measurement, 7) Secure adequate budget and staffing for critical risk mitigation initiatives

checks.name: Limited Vendor Performance Monitoring
checks.description: Vendor performance monitoring lacks comprehensive metrics and proactive management

testResults.details: Limited automation with 77% manual monitoring and basic metrics tracking

testResults.test: Service performance and SLA compliance evaluation
testResults.details: 87.3% uptime compliance with 44 SLA violations and security performance gaps
45% quarterly review coverage with limited escalation and performance enforcement

checks.remediation: MEDIUM PRIORITY: 1) Implement automated vendor performance monitoring for all critical vendors with real-time dashboards, 2) Establish comprehensive performance metrics including security, availability, response time, and compliance indicators, 3) Develop proactive vendor relationship management with regular review meetings and performance discussions, 4) Implement automated SLA monitoring with immediate violation alerts and penalty calculations, 5) Create performance improvement plan templates with milestone tracking and escalation procedures, 6) Establish vendor scorecards with benchmarking against industry standards and peer performance

checks.name: Inadequate Business Continuity Planning
checks.description: Business continuity planning lacks comprehensive vendor dependency analysis and alternative sourcing strategies

testResults.test: Vendor dependency and single point of failure analysis
testResults.details: 8 single points of failure with 12 vendors having limited alternatives

testResults.test: Alternative sourcing and contingency planning assessment
testResults.details: 34% multi-vendor coverage with undeveloped failover procedures

testResults.test: Business continuity testing and validation evaluation
testResults.details: Annual testing with untested vendor compromise and supply chain disruption scenarios

checks.remediation: HIGH PRIORITY: 1) Conduct comprehensive vendor dependency analysis with business impact assessment for all critical services, 2) Develop alternative sourcing strategies including pre-qualified emergency vendors and multi-vendor approaches, 3) Create detailed contingency plans for vendor failure scenarios with validated recovery time estimates, 4) Implement quarterly business continuity testing including vendor compromise and supply chain disruption scenarios, 5) Establish automated failover procedures where possible with regular testing and validation, 6) Develop vendor diversification strategy to reduce single points of failure and geographic concentration risks

checks.name: Missing Supply Chain Governance Framework
checks.description: Supply chain governance lacks structured framework for risk oversight and decision-making

testResults.details: No formal supply chain committee with unclear decision authority and ad-hoc processes

testResults.test: Risk oversight and decision-making framework evaluation
testResults.details: Limited risk reporting with undefined acceptance criteria and inconsistent documentation
Basic cross-functional coordination with limited external stakeholder management

checks.remediation: MEDIUM PRIORITY: 1) Establish formal supply chain governance committee with executive sponsorship and clear decision authority, 2) Develop comprehensive supply chain risk policy with defined procedures for vendor selection, risk assessment, and contractual requirements, 3) Implement structured risk reporting framework with defined KPIs and regular executive visibility, 4) Create risk acceptance criteria and escalation procedures with documented decision-making processes, 5) Enhance cross-functional stakeholder engagement with regular governance meetings and clear role definitions, 6) Establish supply chain governance maturity assessment and continuous improvement program with industry benchmarking
